Package de.rumford.tradingsystem

Class Rule

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.rumford.tradingsystem.Rule
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    EWMAC, VolatilityDifference
    public abstract class Rule
extends Object
    The Rules class provides the functionality necessary for every rule to be used by the other classes of this library. Rules are the centerpiece of a trading system. Based on these rules a system tries to forecast future developments of a given asset and thus advises its user.

    Although every investor should develop their own, these rules need to share some functionality so they can actually be used in this trading system. As soon as the forecast determining calculation is done (done inside the implementation of calculateRawForecast(LocalDateTime)) all rules are treated equally. This ensures compatibility and comparability between rules an between trading systems. Abstract class to be extend on developing new rules for the trading system. calculateAndSetDerivedValues() is called on first invocation of getSdAdjustedForecasts() and getForecastScalar() respectively.

    Author:
    Max Rumford

    • Constructor Detail

      • Rule

        public Rule​(BaseValue baseValue,
            Rule[] variations,
            LocalDateTime startOfReferenceWindow,
            LocalDateTime endOfReferenceWindow,
            double baseScale)
        Public constructor for class Rule. Rule is an abstract class and depends on the way of working of the extending class.
        Parameters:
        baseValue - BaseValue The base value to be used in this rule's calculations. See validateInputs(BaseValue, Rule[], LocalDateTime, LocalDateTime, double) for limitations.
        variations - Rule[] An array of up to 3 rules (or null). See validateInputs(BaseValue, Rule[], LocalDateTime, LocalDateTime, double) for limitations.
        startOfReferenceWindow - LocalDateTime The first LocalDateTime to be considered in calculations such as forecast scalar. See validateInputs(BaseValue, Rule[], LocalDateTime, LocalDateTime, double) for limitations.
        endOfReferenceWindow - LocalDateTime The last LocalDateTime to be considered in calculations such as forecast scalar. See validateInputs(BaseValue, Rule[], LocalDateTime, LocalDateTime, double) for limitations.
        baseScale - double How the forecasts shall be scaled. See validateInputs(BaseValue, Rule[], LocalDateTime, LocalDateTime, double) for limitations.
